name: hypoxic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
medical caused by not enough oxygen being available to the blood and body tissues: He died of hypoxic encephalopathy - a lack of oxygen to the brain, following cardiac arrest. The degree of hypoxic stress depends on altitude, rate of ascent, and duration of exposure. Related word
hypoxiaCompare
anoxic
biology, chemistry, environment (of a place or environment) not having enough oxygen: A hypoxic zone is an area of low oxygen that forms in coastal waters. A hypoxic environment may be deliberately sought by endurance athletes who try to naturally increase their oxygen transport capacity. Compare
anoxic
More examplesFewer examplesThe drug reduces hypoxic pulmonary hypertension.In the case of children who are resuscitated from acute hypoxic insults, the quality of life is generally good.Sometimes nets in a hypoxic zone will find fish, but often they come up empty.There are deep water fish that do fine with even hypoxic water.
